Opponent stones captured in last move. Does not include player stones killed by suicide. Requires that there is a last move (or setup stone).

                 GoPoint point)

See Also:
play(Move)

play

public void play(Move move)
Play a move. Never fails, even if ko rule is violated, suicide or play on occupied points. For example, when loading an SGF file with illegal moves, we still want to be able to load and execute the moves. A move will place a stone of the given color, capture all dead blocks adjacent to the stone, capture the block the stone is part of if it was a suicide move and switches the color to move.

Parameters:
move - The move (location and player)

setToMove

public void setToMove(GoColor toMove)
Change the color to move.

Parameters:
toMove - The new color to move.

setup

public void setup(ConstPointList black,
                  ConstPointList white,
                  GoColor player)
Setup position. Clears the board and move history and sets up a position.

Parameters:
black - Black stones to add on the board.
white - White stones to add on the board.
player - Color to play

setupHandicap

public void setupHandicap(ConstPointList points)
Setup initial handicap stones. This function is similar to an initial setup with only black stones, but it is remembered that the setup was a handicap and it can later be checked with isSetupHandicap.

See Also:
isSetupHandicap()

undo

public void undo()
Undo the last move. Restores any stones removed by the last move (captured or suicide) and the color who was to move before the move.

undo

public void undo(int n)
Undo a number of moves.

Parameters:
n - Number of moves to undo. Must be between 0 and getNumberMoves().
See Also:
undo()
